lead_paragraph: In small-town Iowa, conservative Christians say they feel abandoned, with no true champion in the presidential race and a country that they believe has turned its back.

headline.print_headline: Faith in God, but Spurned by Politics and Culture
headline.main: Torn Over Donald Trump and Cut Off by Culture Wars, Evangelicals Despair

snippet: In small-town Iowa, conservative Christians say they feel abandoned, with no true champion in the presidential race and a country that they believe has turned its back....
abstract: Polls indicate growing majority of evangelical Christians across country are focusing less on their anxieties about economy, jobs and national security than on faith-based issues as presidential election nears; evangelicals in Iowa share sense of abandonment given Donald Trump's constantly changing positions on same-sex marriage and abortion; most are nevertheless backing him, largely out of fear that Clinton presidency would mean appointment of liberal Supreme Court justices (Series: Anxious in America).
